text: Bob Karstens was a professional basketball player in the United States. Karstens was born in Davenport, Iowa and attended school at Iowa Central Turner Gym and St. Ambrose College. A white man, Karstens was the first non- black player on the Harlem Globetrotters' roster in 1942–43. He invented a few routines including the magic circle and the yo yo basketball. He played on the All Black Team, 8 years before the NBA was integrated.https://www.nytimes.com/2005/01/17/sports/basketball/bob-karstens- exglobetrotter-dies-at-89.html?_r=0 He stayed on as a team manager from 1954 to 1994. He died on December 31, 2004. == References == == External links == Category:Harlem Globetrotters players Category:2004 deaths Category:People from Davenport, Iowa Category:St. Ambrose University alumni
title: Bob Karstens
